intro: Justicia tenuis, commonly known as the slender flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branching. Justicia tenuis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
